ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Heritrix'WebUI do not supporting Web application? How to i do?
ygData.msgSnippet: For security, the web UI only listens on localhost/127.0.0.1 by default. To have it listen on any other IP address, you must use the -b command-line switch.

Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Heritrix'WebUI do not supporting Web application?
 How to i do?
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=Y2bp2Sf57HQ0Fd6jxH5M7kEsgSv00tlTK3tmx6ocuuJr
X-Yahoo-Profile: gojomo

For security, the web UI only listens on localhost/127.0.0.1 by default.

To have it listen on any other IP address, you must use the -b 
command-line switch. See:

http://crawler.archive.org/articles/user_manual/install.html#N1008F

You can supply a comma=separated list of IP addresses, or a slash (/) to 
mean 'listen to all'.

- Gordon @ IA

> my machine ip is:192.168.3.54
> 
> heritrix --admin=username:password
> 
> WebUI is success when i input http://localhost:8088/login.jsp
> WebUI is success when i input http://127.0.0.1:8088/login.jsp
> 
> But WebUI is not success when i input http://192.168.3.54:8088/login.jsp
> 
> Heritrix'WebUI do not supporting Web application?
